heaviest_rainfall.status: On 04 January 2025, a record rainfall of 36.8mm was measured, indicating an exceptionally wet day.  4.6mm per hour was recorded as falling at times during the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: A torrential downpour occurred on 02 September 2025 when the rain reached a maximum intensity of 27.0mm per hour.  This happened during a 15.0 hour storm when 21.19mm of rain fell.

longest_rain.status: A relentless rainstorm took place on 04 January 2025, it lasted 37.2 hours and it delivered 36.8mm of rain at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning strikes in one day since 11 April 2025 is 23 and it happened on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: There are no active storms in the area.  The previous storm started on 28 September 2025 and lasted 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is currently no cold snap.  This year there have been 6 cold snaps, usually there are 3.7 cold snaps per year.

extreme.status: The highest recorded temperature difference is 26.7°C from 29 April 2025 (when the temperature reached 27.1°C but fell to 0.4°C).

heatwaves.status: There is not an active heatwaves.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 1.9.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was recorded on 18 July 2025.  The total number of occurrences since 1973 number is only 62.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (188°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The largest wind gust ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

run.status: The largest wind run ever was on 21 October 2012 with a value of 1737 miles.

speed.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind speed recorded on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 2.7°C) and outside temperature (down 2.4°C) and more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 10%).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 736 m) and light levels (up 5636 lux).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 6083 lux) and cloud levels (up 697 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 735.6m lower than yesterday, 665.7m lower than the past week, 697.4m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, cloud levels hit a low of 789m and a high of 3200m, averaging 1041.3m; the past week and month reported somewhat higher averages.
cloud levels.summary: The sky may alternate between sunny and overcast.

summary.summary: Inside; comfortable and pleasant temperatures. Outside; mild and pleasant. Also, humidity should not be a concern and near calm conditions. A few light raindrops may fall, the sky may alternate between sunny and overcast, and a mix of sun and clouds. Little change in the weather.

washing.phrase: The humidity is too high (87%) for your washing to dry quickly.  Any drying will take longer than usual.
